website_summaries.verdict: This powerful racquet will up your game without breaking the bank.
pros: Wilson’s “V-Matrix” frame and cross section are the cornerstones of this racquet, providing extra string bed movement, consistent control, and impressive power
This gives the user more rebound force with each string for faster serves and returns
The weight-to-power ratio is the Striker’s biggest asset
cons: Some users reported the handle unraveling after moderate use

customer_reviews.title: like the $100's ones
customer_reviews.text: Just started playing racquetball and wanted something I could afford that wasn't a serious commitment, like the $100's ones. My game improved with this, better quality than the ones I could borrow from the facility I play at that would unpredictability fling the ball anywhere except where I wanted it to go.
customer_reviews.author: A Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Used this racket 3 times and strings broke, you get what you paid for in this instance. I have been playing racquetball since Dec 2016 and wanted to start at the low end, should of purchased a better racket.
customer_reviews.author: Fishingal

customer_reviews.title: Fine racket. As light as more expensive brands and ...
customer_reviews.text: Fine racket. As light as more expensive brands and performs well. Have used 5+ times and no wear. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer King

customer_reviews.title: Great Value - Very Light
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to racquetball but my buddy that is teaching me to play was very impressed by how light this racquet is for the low price. The grin feels really great. And It’s genuine Wilson brand and very well constructed. It is made in China if that is a deal breaker for you. And the paint started to chip off after just an hour of play(see pictures).
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Excellent first racquet!
customer_reviews.text: These arrived as ordered. These are actually replacements for two racquets we lost somhow. They are a great value. I found them to be durable, and honest-playing. Not only would I buy them again, I actually DID buy them again :-)
customer_reviews.author: EuclidAve

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Weight is good. Grip is OK, I bought a glove that helped me hold on better.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good value. It's not a "high-end" racquet
customer_reviews.text: This is a "good" raqcuet for the price. Good value. It's not a "high-end" racquet, but more than adequate for the average and somewhat above average player.
customer_reviews.author: Pilot Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good Starter Racquet
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good starter racquet. It's very sturdy and its high weight helps with your power if you haven't built up your forearms. If you are someone who has a background of working out or playing sports, I'd recommend a lighter racquet to start out with, as this is quite heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warped After 1 Year
customer_reviews.text: Less than 1 year after buying and it is warped and unusable. I play 2-3 times per month. The other players I play with have better racquets and it is clear this thing not quality. Disappointed in Wilson for this sub par product, I swear by them for my tennis gear.
customer_reviews.author: Rhino Rohan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: I am a beginner in Racquetball and this Racquet was just the perfect price and quality to get me started. Its definitely not heavy and the build looks good. The balance is good too... will recommend surely.
customer_reviews.author: Viki

customer_reviews.title: The lip around the edge of the raquet is pretty big and will take some getting used to (I ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well built raquet (no signs of wear and I hit it against the wall more than I should). The lip around the edge of the raquet is pretty big and will take some getting used to (I don't like it) but it's a really good raquet
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good racquet for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and good racquet for beginners. I bought a couple of these and very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Masudul Quraishi

customer_reviews.title: Ok product for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit heavier compared to the expesive ones. You pretty much get what you pay for. Not bad for the price.
customer_reviews.author: IbnGius

customer_reviews.title: Light and fast
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to get a custom to lighter racket but it great for a fast game.
customer_reviews.author: Latin Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: The #1 brand
customer_reviews.text: I still think Wilson is the #1 brand for Racquetball rackets. Holds up against the brands the guys I play with use.
customer_reviews.author: Jared K

customer_reviews.title: nice light weight for avergag player
customer_reviews.text: tight strings and very good spring back light weight easy on wrist
customer_reviews.author: Sequimite

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Wilson racquets, this one is lightweight and also strokes are also really strong and accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Abhi

customer_reviews.title: Great looking but very heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This Racquet is definitely on the heavier side and I feel like the strings are way too tight. Grip is really nice and it looks fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: xamazonx

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: The product is so good that my game has improved markedly. (is that the reason....? Ha Ha)
customer_reviews.author: Maury Solel

customer_reviews.title: but this price is good
customer_reviews.text: its light and strong, just lose the color on the net, but this price is good choice
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great starter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to get into raquettball; worth the money and works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I got this just to get used to hitting the ball ...a little large, but it's been a long time
customer_reviews.author: Jul

customer_reviews.title: You could pay double for a different one, but don't.
customer_reviews.text: Cheapest one I could find, but nobody can tell. It works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say. Does it’s job. I’m just a casual player.
customer_reviews.author: Hakeem

customer_reviews.title: Good Beginners racquet but had a short handle
customer_reviews.text: It's a good racquetball racquet for a beginner like me the only drawback is the handle is short compared to the other racquet that I tried
customer_reviews.author: yash

customer_reviews.title: It's a good beginners racquet.
customer_reviews.text: The racquet is sturdy and well made. My only complaint would be it is a little heaver then what I would prefer. For its price range it is a good racquet.
customer_reviews.author: tootsie

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners racquet
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great racquet, my only complaint at this price is that the wrist strap is literal garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Eberhard

customer_reviews.title: LOVE AT FIRST SIGHT...IT DIDN'T LAST
customer_reviews.text: At first I liked the weight, the overall look and the price, the racquet was holding up just fine when I was playing 2-3 times a week, however the strings broke after a consecutive week of competitive play. :'( I owned this racquet for three months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RACQUET!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this racquet! I play racquetball about 3 days a week, and I bring my family with me, and they like to use it more than I do!
customer_reviews.author: FONZIE

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner/intermediate level racquet
customer_reviews.text: Has much more power and control than the Head Demon that I had before. Very solid, powerful racquet, great for the money for players of mid-level skill and below
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's held up really well after playing a couple of times a week.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan H.

customer_reviews.title: but the price is great for a casual racquetball player
customer_reviews.text: This racquet is lighter than I had expected, which is a bit of a downfall for me, but the price is great for a casual racquetball player.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: this racquet is a great place to start
customer_reviews.text: As a racquetball amateur, this racquet is a great place to start.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Price to performance
customer_reviews.text: Great product play once or twice a week and it’s been good these past 4 months
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and lightweight. Perfect for beginner or novice.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn S. Irish

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality _Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: The racquet is of very bad quality. The handle is not strong enough and the tapes came out while I played for the first time. As well the paint on the strings started to fall off during my first game only.
customer_reviews.author: Pavan Tirumalaraju

customer_reviews.title: Good basic racquetball racquet.
customer_reviews.text: Good basic racquetball racquet. I like the price and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I received a tennis racquet instead of a racquetball.
customer_reviews.text: I got a tennis racquets instead of a racquetball racquet . Just look at the image , they’re are completely different from what I got .
customer_reviews.author: Rene Flores

customer_reviews.title: Cuts through the wind like a lighting bolt from Zuse
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy sent a piss missile right into the back of my competition. Softball size welt. Totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Good racquet for casual play
customer_reviews.text: As a casual player this is a solid racquetball racquet. We bought a pair of them to use at the outdoor courts that were recently built nearby and have had no issues at all with them. I've even managed to hit them into the concrete wall and put a small dent in one of them but it did not seem to affect the racquet's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Huebsch

customer_reviews.title: its a great racquetball racket
customer_reviews.text: For the price, its a great racquetball racket. I'm just a beginner who plays with friends a few times a month.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Broke down after second use. Not durable
customer_reviews.text: Awful racket. Grip started coming off after second use. Ended up cutting my hand on the jagged edges underneath as a result. Disappointed considering the overall rating of the product.
customer_reviews.author: tteister

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Overall I’m satisfied with the racquet and how it feels playing. Not a bad buy for it’s price!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Good first racquet
customer_reviews.text: Awesome first racquet. I'm just getting into the game and needed some budget gear. This is working nicely for me. It's light, had a good wrist strap and makes me feel like I have a lot of power.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: ... frame is kinda weak and seems to bend very easy.
customer_reviews.text: The frame is kinda weak and seems to bend very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Sedushak

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A perfectly cromulent value buy. It's survived a few months of use with no breakage.
customer_reviews.author: Graeme MacDougall

customer_reviews.title: Don't get it if you want to enjoy real games
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap quality. Don't get it if you want to enjoy real games.
customer_reviews.author: VZ

customer_reviews.title: Bad buy
customer_reviews.text: Strings and handle both broke within 20 minutes of moderate use. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Product had broken strings out of the box. It's a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They liked the feel of the racquet
customer_reviews.text: My sons were impressed with the quality of the racquet for such a low cost. They liked the feel of the racquet. They like a lighter racquet to use in their games. They play just for fun with friends at a local community center, so this racquet was perfect for them.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Sanford

customer_reviews.title: I am an amateur racquetball player and this racket suits ...
customer_reviews.text: I am an amateur racquetball player and this racket suits all my needs! I've whacked it into the wall and the ground a couple times and it's held up all the smacking.
customer_reviews.author: KristArt

customer_reviews.title: I've become the first racquet of bravos
customer_reviews.text: This is the first racquetball racquet I have ever bought and I love it. I'm straight killing folks in my racquetball class in college. I feel like the Australian guy from Along Came Polly while hitting balls hard than Mike Tyson. Rocky Carson better watch his back when I slide this baby out of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jackin' It

customer_reviews.title: The quality is 1 step above Walmart. Because it ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality is 1 step above Walmart. Because it wasn't too expensive, I have it three starts. However, I bought a Wilson (different model) for $3 more, and there was a huge difference in quality. I'd say, shop around a little more.
customer_reviews.author: S. Baker

customer_reviews.title: I love the tension/sweet spot on Ektelon better
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backup raquet. I love the tension/sweet spot on Ektelon better.
customer_reviews.author: V. Reddy

product_meta.title: Wilson Striker Racquetball Racquet
feature_bullets: V-Matrix frame allows for extra string bed movement and greater power
V-Matrix cross section for added stiffness providing more power and strength
Wilson is the Official racquet of USA Racquetball
V-Matrix cross section for added stiffness providing more power and strength
Perfect for a player looking to add more power to their game
